hero.description: With a passion for data and a love for smart, clean code. Quick to learn, positive in teams ‚Äì always chasing clever solutions.

about.title: About Me
about.paragraph1: As a Full Stack Developer, I love working across the stack ‚Äî because why pick just frontend or backend when you can have both? My sweet spot: data. Collecting it, shaping it, using it. Whether at work or in my side projects, I'm always tinkering with new ways to gather and wrangle information.
about.paragraph2: I dive into new topics fast and get genuinely excited about what I do. That enthusiasm usually rubs off, and I try to keep things positive, focused, and fun around the dev table.
about.paragraph3: Before coding, I was a tutor, a photographer, and even a team lead at the Red Cross. All those roles taught me to see things from different angles ‚Äî and yes, sometimes to debug people problems before code ones.

projects.title: Private Projects
projects.description: Here are some of my recent projects. From developing innovative platform analysis solutions to advanced web scraping tools, these projects reflect my passion for modern web technologies and efficient software solutions. Each project presents its own technical challenges and learning opportunities.

fritz.title: Fritz ‚Äì December 2024
fritz.description: My most meaningful launch to date: My son, project Fritz. Deployed December 2024, full of love, potential, and long-term support plans. Features include sleepless nights, heart-melting smiles, and a rapidly evolving API for joy.

marktzone.title: MarktZone.io
marktzone.description: A smart analysis tool for monitoring and comparing Amazon marketplaces. Built to uncover trends, track products, and reveal hidden insights across regional markets.

checkdiepreise.title: check-die-preise.de
checkdiepreise.description: Scrapes online shops and analyzes historical price data to track trends and spot deals. Your backend-powered detective for price evolution and e-commerce intel.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: I look forward to hearing from you. Simply fill out the form, and I will get back to you as soon as possible.

form.header: Contact Form - Ping me like a Pro

cv.title: Education & Certifications
cv.description: My educational path reflects my passion for technology and continuous learning. Starting with a degree in Geography, where I delved deeply into the world of models and data analysis, I transitioned into computer science and modern web technologies. Through formal education and professional certifications, I have built a diverse skillset that combines theoretical knowledge with practical expertise in cloud computing and web development.
cv.info: Click on any point in the timeline to learn more about each milestone.

bta.title: Bio. Technic. Assistant
bta.description: Vocational training as a certified Biological Technical Assistant at Lise-Meitner-Schule in Berlin. Acquired strong analytical skills and scientific foundations that have proven valuable for a systematic approach to complex technical problems.

bachelor.title: B.A, HU Berlin
bachelor.description: Bachelor of Arts (Geography) with a focus on analytical thinking and problem-solving. Combined theoretical knowledge with practical applications in scientific computing.

master.title: M.A, University of Illinois, USA
master.description: Master of Science with a specialization in data analysis and computational methods. Gained in-depth expertise in statistical analysis and data-driven decision-making. Worked as a statistics tutor.

teamleader.title: Team Lead
teamleader.description: DRK Fl√ºchtlingshilfe Brandenburg gGmbH, Doberlug-Kirchhain, social support. Leadership role including building and managing a team of 10 staff members, creating duty and personnel development plans. Responsible for training, evaluation and monitoring, staff appraisals, cross-functional coordination, reporting, and budget accountability.

fullstack.title: Full Stack Software Developer
fullstack.description: Fullstack development of modern applications using .NET Core, Entity Framework, Python, and automated testing (Selenium/UIPath). Daily use of Git for version control and close collaboration in agile teams. Key projects include a modular business management app (Blazor, ASP.NET Core, PostgreSQL) and a lab middleware system (Spring Boot, Java, Docker).

instructor.title: IT Instructor
instructor.description: cimdata Bildungsakademie GmbH. Independently organized and taught 4-week modules with around 15 participants. Modules included: Python (Basics, Data Science in Python), Dart & Flutter, HTML5 & CSS3 (Basics and Advanced, including SASS). Delivered knowledge on programming languages and state-of-the-art technologies. Full-time course, Monday to Friday via Zoom.

az900.title: AZ 900
az900.description: Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900), Microsoft certified. Cloud basics and benefits ‚Äì scalability, availability, cost. Overview of Azure services ‚Äì compute, storage, networking, databases. Security, compliance, and data protection in Azure. Understanding pricing, SLAs, and cloud lifecycle.

dp209.title: DP 203
dp209.description: Microsoft certified. Azure Data Engineer Associate (DP-203). Storing data in Azure ‚Äì Lake, Blob, Synapse and more. Building pipelines with Data Factory & Spark for clean data flows. Optimizing and transforming models ‚Äì using SQL, Python, Delta Lake. Ensuring security, monitoring, and scaling of stable data platforms.

pcap.title: PCAP
pcap.description: PCAP ‚Äì Certified Associate Python Programmer, Python Institute. Mastering data types, variables, loops, and conditionals. Using functions, modules, and handling exceptions properly. Understanding OOP: classes, inheritance, methods, and constructors. Applying standard libraries ‚Äì from strings to file access.

pcep.title: PCEP
pcep.description: PCEP ‚Äì Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer, Python Institute. Learning fundamentals: syntax, data types, variables, input/output. Applying operators, conditionals, and loops confidently. Writing functions and spotting simple errors. Understanding lists, tuples, dictionaries, and core Python logic.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.content:
1. Privacy at a Glance

General Notes
The following notes provide a simple overview of what happens to your personal data when you visit this website. Personal data is any data that can be used to personally identify you.

Data Collection on this Website

Who is responsible for data collection on this website?
The data processing on this website is carried out by the website operator. You can find their contact details in the legal notice of this website.

How do we collect your data?
On the one hand, your data is collected when you communicate it to us. This can be, for example, data that you enter in the contact form.

Other data is collected automatically by our IT systems when you visit the website. These are mainly technical data (e.g., internet browser, operating system, or time of page view). This data is collected automatically as soon as you enter this website.

What do we use your data for?
Some of the data is collected to ensure the proper functioning of the website. Other data can be used to analyze your user behavior.

What rights do you have regarding your data?
You have the right to receive information about the origin, recipient, and purpose of your stored personal data at any time, free of charge. You also have the right to request the correction or deletion of this data. For this purpose, as well as for further questions about data protection, you can contact us at any time at the address given in the legal notice.

2. General Notes and Mandatory Information

Data Protection
The operators of these pages take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the statutory data protection regulations and this privacy policy.

Note on the Responsible Party
The party responsible for processing data on this website is:

Sebastian Christoph
Am Stadion 17
36433 Bad Salzungen

Email: hallo@sebastianchristoph.com

3. Data Collection on this Website

Contact Form
If you send us inquiries via the contact form, your information from the inquiry form, including the contact details you provided there, will be stored by us for the purpose of processing the inquiry and in case of follow-up questions. We will not share this data without your consent.

The processing of this data is based on Art. 6 (1) lit. b GDPR if your request is related to the execution of a contract or is necessary for the implementation of pre-contractual measures. In all other cases, the processing is based on our legitimate interest in the effective processing of the requests addressed to us (Art. 6 (1) lit. f GDPR) or on your consent (Art. 6 (1) lit. a GDPR) if this has been requested.

The data you enter in the contact form will remain with us until you request us to delete it, revoke your consent to storage, or the purpose for data storage no longer applies (e.g., after your request has been processed). Mandatory statutory provisions - especially retention periods - remain unaffected.

company.title: Modularized Business and HR Management App
company.description: In this project, an existing SaaS web application for personnel management and business organization was redeveloped as a modular Blazor web app based on ASP.NET Core. The application enables, among other things, the management of employee data, business organization, and the creation of graphical dashboards. My team took on all project roles, from requirement engineering to deployment. I worked in an international team with members from Switzerland, Spain, and Germany.

details.backend_tech: Entity Framework Core (with Mediator Pattern via MediatR), .NET 8

lab.title: On-Market Support of a Laboratory Middleware
lab.description: In this project, I supported the further development and maintenance of a laboratory middleware software for a leading pharmaceutical company. The software optimizes laboratory workflows through a rule engine and a communication module and is used worldwide to replace existing middleware products. Particularly challenging was working with extensive legacy code that needed to be modernized and optimized. My team took on analysis, implementation, testing, and validation in the agile development process. I worked in an international team with members from Switzerland, Spain, and Germany.

details.backend_tech: Spring Boot, Jenkins (CI/CD), Docker, Apache Webserver
details.dev_tech: MS Visual Studio, IntelliJ IDEA, Maven, Gradle
details.quality_tech: HP Application Lifecycle Management, Westgard Rules
